alert.note: Alert for Schoharie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Schoharie County through 545 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over North Blenheim, or 14 miles south of Cobleskill, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jefferson, Summit, North Blenheim, West Jefferson, Beards Hollow, South Gilboa, South Jefferson, Baird Corners, Vorman Corners, Lutheranville, Ruth, East Jefferson, Five Corners, Arabia, Welch Corners, West Conesville, Mackey, Eminence, Owlsville and Charlotteville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
